examples.description: Given the current date is 2017-01-01 -> And a UK Limited Company which was started on 2016-01-01 -> And its first accounting year ends on 2016-12-31 -> And it has a contact in United Kingdom named Winston Churchill set to always charge VAT -> And the company has CIS categories -> And they are running payroll in the 2017 tax year on the 25th of each month -> Given a Alternate Arrangements payroll profile with Tax Code 1100L -> And they are paid 2000 monthly -> Given a sent invoice to Winston Churchill dated on 2016-04-10 -> And the CIS deduction rate on the invoice is set at 20% -> And a CIS line item is added for 1000 with 0% VAT -> When adding a payment in 750-1 for 800 dated 2016-04-10 to the invoice -> And it should be valid -> And for month 1 a zero payslip was submitted -> And running payroll for month 2 -> Then the payroll period should have ledger entries -> And the "CIS Deductions" account should be empty -> And the "PAYE/NI" account should be 175.07 in credit
examples.full_description: Payroll Ledger Builder CIS (Subcontractors) Running payroll in month 2 when deductions carried forward from previous month Given the current date is 2017-01-01 -> And a UK Limited Company which was started on 2016-01-01 -> And its first accounting year ends on 2016-12-31 -> And it has a contact in United Kingdom named Winston Churchill set to always charge VAT -> And the company has CIS categories -> And they are running payroll in the 2017 tax year on the 25th of each month -> Given a Alternate Arrangements payroll profile with Tax Code 1100L -> And they are paid 2000 monthly -> Given a sent invoice to Winston Churchill dated on 2016-04-10 -> And the CIS deduction rate on the invoice is set at 20% -> And a CIS line item is added for 1000 with 0% VAT -> When adding a payment in 750-1 for 800 dated 2016-04-10 to the invoice -> And it should be valid -> And for month 1 a zero payslip was submitted -> And running payroll for month 2 -> Then the payroll period should have ledger entries -> And the "CIS Deductions" account should be empty -> And the "PAYE/NI" account should be 175.07 in credit

examples.description: Given the current date is 2017-01-01 -> And a UK Limited Company which was started on 2016-01-01 -> And its first accounting year ends on 2016-12-31 -> And it has a contact in United Kingdom named Winston Churchill set to always charge VAT -> And the company has CIS categories -> And they are running payroll in the 2017 tax year on the 25th of each month -> Given a Alternate Arrangements payroll profile with Tax Code 1100L -> And they are paid 2000 monthly -> Given month 1 payroll has been marked as filed -> And the following journals were entered dated 2016-04-10 -> When running payroll for month 2 -> Then the payroll period should have ledger entries -> And the "CIS Deductions" account should be empty -> And the "PAYE/NI" account should be 517.14 in credit

examples.description: Given the current date is 2017-01-01 -> And a UK Limited Company which was started on 2016-01-01 -> And its first accounting year ends on 2016-12-31 -> And it has a contact in United Kingdom named Winston Churchill set to always charge VAT -> And the company has CIS categories -> And they are running payroll in the 2017 tax year on the 25th of each month -> Given a Alternate Arrangements payroll profile with Tax Code 1100L -> And they are paid 2000 monthly -> Given month 1 payroll has been marked as filed -> And a PAYE NI bank payment dated on 2016-05-01 for 558.47 -> And a sent invoice to Winston Churchill dated on 2016-04-10 -> And the CIS deduction rate on the invoice is set at 20% -> And a CIS line item is added for 3000 with 0% VAT -> When adding a payment in 750-1 for 2400 dated 2016-05-10 to the invoice -> And it should be valid -> When month 2 payroll is prepared -> Then the payroll period should have ledger entries -> And the "CIS Deductions" account should be 41.33 in debit -> And the "PAYE/NI" account should be empty

examples.description: Given the current date is 2017-01-01 -> And a UK Limited Company which was started on 2016-01-01 -> And its first accounting year ends on 2016-12-31 -> And it has a contact in United Kingdom named Winston Churchill set to always charge VAT -> And the company has CIS categories -> And they are running payroll in the 2017 tax year on the 25th of each month -> Given a Alternate Arrangements payroll profile with Tax Code 1100L -> And they are paid 2000 monthly -> Given month 1 payroll has been marked as filed -> And the employee is marked as leaving employment on 2016-05-25 -> And a sent invoice to Winston Churchill dated on 2016-04-10 -> And the CIS deduction rate on the invoice is set at 20% -> And a CIS line item is added for 2500 with 0% VAT -> When adding a payment in 750-1 for 2000 dated 2016-04-10 to the invoice -> And it should be valid -> When running payroll for month 2 -> Then the payroll period should have ledger entries -> And the "CIS Deductions" account should be 67 in debit -> And the "PAYE/NI" account should be empty
